Summary Currently I am working as Services operations Business Analyst for client (Cisco Systems Inc.). This role is elemental towards driving Cisco strategy and initiatives to fruition. I have a thorough domain knowledge in Channel management, Partner relationship management, Partner Compensation, Sales enablement, Quoting and Ordering, SFDC, Leads and Opportunity 
 
I have built myself as a mature and motivated professional over a period of 10 + years. I have worked in various roles that demanded strong domain knowledge, cross functional team collaboration, leadership and time critical deliveries.  
 
I have a proven track record striving for Operational excellence, Customer Satisfaction and Business growth. To second my professional performance I have been regularly awarded and appreciated by Customer and Organisation. 
 
Key Highlights 
• Strong domain knowledge that includes in depth understanding of Channels, product/services sales operations, partner lifecycle management, program management and partner compensation.  
• Strong domain knowledge of various commerce processes like Lead management, Opportunity,management and Quoting & Ordering. 
• Business Intelligence/forecasting dashboards design for historical trends analysis, pattern recognition, data-profiling, preemptive and predictive analysis. 
• Model business process, consolidate and improve existing business processes.  
• Document White papers, Functional Requirement Specifications, Business Requirement specifications, Wireframes, Mock ups, UI Design, Use Cases, Process Flow Diagrams, Swim Lane Diagrams and Data Analysis.  
• Conduct feasibility analysis, Cost Benefit Analysis to evaluate solution options and ensure most favourable outcome in optimum cost.  
 
Analytical Tools - MS Visio, Dreamweaver, IBM Rational System Architect 11.3.1

* Cross-functional collaboration and problem solving Experience Sr. Business Analyst/Project Manager Cisco August 2013  – Present (2 years 1 month) San Jose, CA Lead Business Analyst for Opportunity Renewals and Auto Quote: 
 
Opportunity Reports Automation: 
 
Our team used to pull Opportunity data from Qlikview IB 360 and process that manually. That required four fully dedicated team members. In order to automate the process, we had to have a repository of same data.  
•	I acted as a DBA/Server Admin to maintain a complex Oracle data base (700 Million records) of al Cisco Opportunity data, which allowed our team developers to conduct testing needed to automate data pulling.  
•	Automated Renewals reports (used to take 2.5 hours each, now down to ten minutes) 
 
Auto Quotes Reports Automation: 
 
In a similar effort, DF Team collaborated with Auto Quote team to enhance and automate their reports. They currently have to download their reports manually and are restricted in the scope of fields available. The end goal is a set of automated reports available on demand anytime and are comprehensive to include bookings and quotation detailed data.  
•	I worked as a lead business analyst by generating and processing ninety three reports weekly for Auto Quote team.  
•	Collected requirement for new desired reports, worked with Teradata team to identify the most accurate tables/views to provide that, conducted testing, then provided the Auto Quote team with sample reports for UAT testing. The project is ongoing, expected to be fully automated in a month. Sr. Business Analyst Cisco July 2012  –  August 2013  (1 year 2 months) San Jose, CA Establishing and automating BI reporting for Industry Sales team 
 
•	Worked with management to identify useful metrics and KPIs necessary for reporting, then furnished that in useful weekly dashboards. 
•	Prepared quarterly and monthly performance analysis packages as well as ad-hoc reports as needed. 
•	Maintained strong cross functional relationships with business partners within Operations and Finance to understand business and data. 
•	Automated processes as needed using VBA and macros. 
•	Worked as a PM with IT Automation team to migrate reporting packages into automated reports by providing requirements definition, BA testing, validation, and UAT testing. 
•	Communicated status to stakeholders and escalated unresolved issues to the appropriate level of management in a timely manner till the project was successfully completed. Sr. Business Analyst/Project Manager Acomx.com October 2011  –  July 2012  (10 months) San Francisco, CA Implementation of Hyperoin Planning & Revenue Recognition Activities: 
 
•Prepared project status reports and kept management, clients, and others informed of project status and related issues	 
•Assisted in requirement solicitation, creating related documents, communication with developers, and testing activities.  
•Performed revenue accounting and reporting activities on monthly basis.  
•Processed timely invoices and performed month-end account reconciliations. 
•Resolved revenue related issues and completed follow-up on outstanding items.  
•Assisted in development of company finance policies and internal finance controls.  
•Assisted in financial audits and implemented audit recommendations.  
•Reviewed and recommended improvements to current revenue recognition strategies.  
•Prepared documentations of all revenue related activities as per company procedures.  
•Provided assistance and conducted job trainings for the revenue team when required. Business Analyst/Project Coordinator JDSU February 2011  –  October 2011  (9 months) San Jose, CA Upgrade of Oracle EBS to R12 
•	Supported IT Program Management initiatives on tracking and updating the project plan and coordinated planning activities across multiple teams.  
•	Actively communicated with corporate stakeholders to manage the impact of change and communicated project status expectations and timelines.	 
•	Identified and presented project related issues and facilitated resolutions within and across functions. 
•	Was responsible for maintaining project reports as well as supporting ad-hoc reporting requests.	 
•	Provided project support in scheduling/facilitating meetings, creating agenda, recording meeting notes and following up on action items.	 
•	Collected functional requirements for Oracle EBS R12 configuration.	 
•	Monitored and reported on all assigned projects within published timelines using project management standards and the appropriate project management tools. Business Analyst/Project Coordinator Opnext June 2010  –  February 2011  (9 months) Fremont, CA Implementation of Hyperion Planning and migration from Oracle Discoverer to Qlikview: 
 
•Collaborated with business and IT owners and subject matter experts to develop an understanding of business processes and functions to aid in completing the standard project business case related to a proposed project, analyzing business requirements and identifying potential business solutions 
•Prepared executive status reporting, change and scope management, escalation detection and issue resolution.  
•Performed vendor management responsibilities as required based on project need.	 
•Conducted weekly meetings with cross functional teams to review key project milestones, accomplishments, and risks.

Oracle Financials:  
 
•Worked closely with IT and finance departments as an Oracle Financials “Super User” and supported Finance Dept. in sub-ledger & general ledger reconciliation activities and financial close process in Oracle 
•Supported end users with issues related to the following modules: GL, AR, AP, FA, OM and Inv.  
 
Hyperion Planning:  
 
•Provided Hyperion implementation team with data needed from Oracle through Toad queries and standard reports.  
•Assisted implementation team in reaching solutions for issues that came up during implementation.  
•Conducted testing of forms and calculations vs. Oracle Budgeting using Essbase SmartView, Excel, and Access. Business Analyst/Project Coordinator VMware December 2009  –  June 2010  (7 months) Palo Alto, CA Implementation of OBIEE 
 
•Actively supported the project management team's efforts to include: project plan, scope management, budget management, resource management, time management (activities, scheduling and task planning), communications, risk, procurement, testing, user training, program / project delivery, transition, maintenance and support management.	 
•Reported project progress, issues, and risks through weekly status reports.	 
•Published key messages for projects by understanding communication requirements of key stakeholders, providing outcome-based, crisp and actionable communication, escalating critical issues and risks promptly, regular communication to customers on accomplishments, initiatives (scope, schedule & budget), application support, risk management, key next steps and clear owners of key next steps.	 
•Acted as the liaison between stakeholders (end users, developers, and management) to ensure requirements are collected properly, communicated clearly, applied correctly, and tested successfully. Business Analyst / Project Coordinator CR-Tech July 2008  –  December 2009  (1 year 6 months) San Jose, CA Upgrading Oracle EBS 11i to R12:

Summary I am a highly analytical, skilled and motivated Business Analyst. I posses excellent communication skills and have a background in Project Management, Training and all phases of software development (utilizing both waterfall and agile processes), providing me with a unique skill mix.  
 
As a Senior Business Analyst and liaison to Stakeholders and End-Users of an organization, I quickly gain knowledge of the related business processes to aid the business in communicating their needs for system and business process improvements. I work with Stakeholders and End-Users to determine where there will be value-add by creating or improving software tools, based on technical, budget and time constraints. I engage in the full life cycle, ensuring the success of the software tool(s) in both meeting the intention of the Stakeholders and in End User adoption. To this end, I conduct business and functional requirements workshops, construct detailed specification documentation, and work with the technical team to determine feasibility of the desired functionality. I conduct usability sessions, create Use Cases, develop UAT scripts and manage UAT sessions. To aid in user adoption, I work with the communications resources to facilitate change management communications, create user guides, training materials and conduct training sessions. My projects cross many functional areas, for a wide variety of industries. Summary I am a highly analytical, skilled and motivated Business Analyst.
